meanings.definition: To walk faster or farther than someone else.
meanings.sent1: She outwalked her friend to the park.
meanings.sent2: The athlete outwalked the competition to win the race.
meanings.sent3: The tortoise outwalked the hare in the race, surprising everyone.
meanings.sent4: Her determination outwalked any obstacles in her path.
meanings.sent5: The cheetah outwalked all other animals with its incredible speed.

meanings.sent1: He outwalked his previous record by a mile.
meanings.sent2: The hiker outwalked his companions on the trail.
meanings.sent3: The snail outwalked the caterpillar, much to the caterpillar's dismay.
meanings.sent4: Her enthusiasm outwalked her tiredness, propelling her forward.
meanings.sent5: The marathon runner outwalked his own limits to reach the finish line.
